events.name: Applying automated reasoning to find security bugs
events.description:
Presentation Description:
You might have heard that solvers can be used to perform automated reasoning on binary software to find security bugs. How does a solver perform automated reasoning? And how do they fit into the usual bag of tools (such as disassemblers and fuzzers) used by the security community? In this talk, I will explain how everything fits in, and walk through the various ways to apply solvers to analyze software to find security bugs, through both static and dynamic analysis. Then, I will talk about the latest exciting developments, and some of the cutting-edge research that we and our collaborators are working on. I will end with a demo, and walk through some open-source tools that security folks can readily play with to get started.

Free pizza will be served before the talk at around 6:30pm! (courtesy of DSO National Laboratories)

Speaker's Biography:
Chia Yuan is a Program Manager and Principal Scientist at DSO National Laboratories. He leads a department of scientists and engineers to conduct R&D on cyber security. He obtained his PhD from the University of California, Berkeley.
